conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D and needs to be predicted whether it will flow into container E or F.
Analyze the path of the liquid as it moves down the channel.
Liquid starts from points A, B, C, and D at the top of the channel.
Liquid from point A flows downward along the blue baffle.
Liquid from point A continues straight until it reaches the bottom of the channel.
Blue baffle directs liquid from point A towards the left side, into container E.
Liquid from point B flows downward along the gray baffle.
Liquid from point B continues straight until it reaches the bottom of the channel.
Gray baffle directs liquid from point B towards the left side, into container E.
Liquid from point C flows downward along the yellow baffle.
Liquid from point C continues straight until it reaches the bottom of the channel.
Yellow baffle directs liquid from point C towards the right side, into container F.
Liquid from point D flows downward along the green baffle.
Liquid from point D continues straight until it reaches the bottom of the channel.
Green baffle directs liquid from point D towards the right side, into container F.
Liquid from points A and B will flow into container E.
Liquid from points C and D will flow into container F.
Container E will receive liquid from points A and B; container F will receive liquid from points C and D.
